org.echo.mobile.framework.model

Class AssetAmount

  • org.echo.mobile.framework.model.AssetAmount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSerializable, GrapheneSerializable, JsonSerializable

    public class AssetAmount
implements GrapheneSerializable

    Class used to represent a specific amount of a certain asset

    • Method Detail

      • plus

        public AssetAmount plus(AssetAmount other)

        Adds two asset amounts. They must refer to the same Asset type.

        Parameters:
        other - : The other AssetAmount to add to this.
        Returns:
        : A new instance of the AssetAmount class with the combined amount.

      • plus

        public AssetAmount plus(long additional)

        Adds an aditional amount of base units to this AssetAmount.

        Parameters:
        additional - : The amount to add.
        Returns:
        : A new instance of the AssetAmount class with the added aditional.

      • minus

        public AssetAmount minus(AssetAmount other)

        Subtracts another instance of AssetAmount from this one. This method will always return absolute values.

        Parameters:
        other - : The other asset amount to subtract from this.
        Returns:
        : The absolute value of the subtraction of the other minus this asset amount.

      • div

        public AssetAmount div(double divisor)

        Divides the current amount by a divisor provided as the first parameter, using the RoundingMode.HALF_DOWN constant

        Parameters:
        divisor - : The divisor
        Returns:
        : The same AssetAMount instance, but with the divided amount value
        See Also:
        RoundingMode.HALF_DOWN

      • times

        public AssetAmount times(double factor)

        Multiplies the current amount by a factor, using the {@link RoundingMode#HALF_DOWN} constant.

        Parameters:
        factor - : The multiplying factor
        Returns:
        The same AssetAmount instance, but with the changed amount value.

      • multiplyBy

        public AssetAmount multiplyBy(double factor,
                              java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)

        Multiplies the current amount by a factor provided as the first parameter. The second parameter specifies the rounding method to be used.

        Parameters:
        factor - : The multiplying factor
        roundingMode - : The rounding mode as an instance of the {@link RoundingMode} class
        Returns:
        The same AssetAmount instance, but with the changed amount value.
